leafletText: A few words about today’s performance (*) Actors: Viewers - actors! During the performance, the viewer-actors can take notes, measure, calculate, and verify things for themselves. For those who are curious: the director “measures everything” with respect to the center of the stage and the viewers’ perspective. • Acts: 3! -Kinematics in… Algebra! -Dynamics in… Algebra! -Energy in… Algebra! • Language: Algebra (no translator available) • The opening of the curtain, the start of the show, is determined by you, our viewer-actors! What will you see? “Harmonic stuff”! — maybe a bit monotonous, but absolutely determined, since we’re dealing with the protagonist m1D1. If you’re wondering what “unique temperament” means for a protagonist, here’s the deal: Each different protagonist (m1, D1), (m2, D2), …, (mi, Di) has its own period. In other words: to go from one side of the stage to the other and come back, it always takes the same characteristic time. So its “unique temperament” is grounded in its “body type”: its mass mi and its spring constant Di. Still, if the same (miDi) is given a different (say, larger) stage, it will do exactly the same back-and-forth — it will just have more space to travel. So remember: 1. these — and only these — are the skills/capabilities of each protagonist (we call it, in general, the oscillator (miDi)) 2. the “budget” of the production and of course the size of the stage are each time exclusively your responsibility 3. the moment of Start is decided exclusively by you! Enjoy! (*) orange soda, lemonade, chips at the foyer BAR
